data.subject: habitat
data.desc: Helichrysum arenarium, also known as the Dwarf Everlast, is a perennial plant that is native to Europe and Asia. It is a hardy plant that can grow in a variety of soil types, but prefers a well-draining soil that is not too rich. It is drought-tolerant and prefers full sun. If you want to grow it from seeds, you can start to grow your annual Helichrysum seeds indoors six to eight weeks before the last frosts in spring. First, fill a seed tray with seed sowing compost and water well until the compost is moist. Lightly sprinkle the seeds on top of the compost thinly and then cover them with a thin layer of sieved seed compost[1]. If you want to grow it in the garden, it prefers a poor to moderate sandy (or rocky) dry soil, that has good drainage. Late sowings can be made out of doors in early May. The rock garden kinds all like dry sunny, spots with sharp drainage, and make good scree plants[2].

data.subject: benefits
data.desc: Helichrysum arenarium, also known as the Dwarf Everlast, has many benefits. It is known to remove spasms, provide secretion of gastric juice, prevent hemorrhoids, remove urine while cleaning the urinary tract, prevent allergies, fight infections, and more1. Helichrysum essential oil, which is derived from the plant, has many benefits as well. It is an antispasmodic, anticoagulant, antiallergenic, anti-microbial, anti-hematoma, antiphlogistic, nervine, anti-inflammatory, antitussive, cicatrizant, and an expectorant[2]. It reportedly has anti-inflammatory, antifungal, and antibacterial properties[3]. However, while in-lab and animal studies are promising, there is little research on its effectiveness in humans
